name: Start
subtitle: Designing Conversational Experiences: A Guide To Design and Deploy Technology That Talks To People and Delights

name: Goal
subtitle: Define the personality. Design the conversation. Create and Deploy a conversationally intelligent agent.

name: Explanation
subtitle: We have entered a promising new era of computing, where the advances in artificial intelligence and machine learning have brought to the forefront new possibilities of interacting through  voice interfaces by means of natural language processing.
bodytext: These advancements give us as humans the ability to talk to our cars, phones, watches, homes and companies. Creating a conversational experience through a unique design process can unlock technologies' potentional for conversation as a new mode of interaction. Facilitating connections and strengthening relationships.

name: Voice Interaction
subtitle: Principles about Conversation to Know
bodytext: A converstaional experience really needs to feel human to work. So we have to have an understanding of how we as humans converse. These have been defined as conversational principles we can adhere. They can provide a structure for our agent so it can feel like we are conversing with a human as much as possible. And hence the conversation feels natural. The follwing principles are summarized from Google's resources on learning about conversation.

steps.subtitle: Turn Taking
steps.bodytext: 'We take turns in a conversation based on subtle signals that we pass back and forth. Without effective turn-taking, we might talk over each other, or our conversations can get out of sync and hard to follow.'

steps.subtitle: Threading
steps.bodytext: In natural speech, all elements of a conversation are usually woven together in a co-herent thread that includes context and the way the conversation evolves over time. Threading helps us keep track of that conversational flow.

steps.subtitle: We Are Inherently Efficient
steps.bodytext: People often use verbal shortcuts because they intuitively understand what’s being said—essentially, we can “read between the lines” in a conversation and some things can be left unspoken. But the implication for VUIs is having to compensate for the seemingly illogical, non-math-ematical nature of human speech.

steps.subtitle: Variations and Synonyms
steps.bodytext: People use a variety of words and styles to say the same thing, depending on their own situational context and expectations of a VUI based on previous experience. VUIs should support these variations so all users can have a frictionless experience.

name: Link
bodytext: We are going to make an intelligent assistant we can talk to.

The first thing we need to do is define the personality of our intelligent machine. As a business, ogransization or a general assistant how we talk and the emotions we invoke through dialogue will have a lasting impact on how we are perceived.

steps.subtitle: Let's define who we are by answering some questions.
steps.bodytext: Imagine our AI is a real person in the world. What job would it do? How does it serve people or our customers?

steps.subtitle: People or your customers would describe you as.
steps.bodytext: List the top three adjectives that would define you as a person.

steps.subtitle: How do we not want to be defined.
steps.bodytext: List the top three adjectives that we do not want our personality to be defined by.

steps.subtitle: We should have something like this:
steps.bodytext: If we were a real person we would be a librarian. We would help curate and recommend books to read by listening to people's interests, what they have read in the past and present suggestions. We would be described as knowledgable, quikry, and attentive. And we would never want to come off as snobby, cheeky, or impatient.

steps.subtitle: Get Into Character
steps.bodytext: Defining our personality provides us with a stragetic goal to aim for in our conversations. We can now write sentences that exemplify the expression we wish to convey. Think of words and styles of sentences that can bring the personality to life. Write out and document these sentences. Do those sentences convey the desired personality?

subtitle: Now that we have defined the personality, we have to empathize with our customers to design the conversation that meets their needs.
Now that we have defined the personality, we have to empathize with our customers to design the conversation that meets their needs.

steps.subtitle: The Opening
steps.bodytext: The first thing we need to do is define the context. The user or customer needs to know what you can help with. In a human way based off the personality we defined earlier. Write an opening sentence introducing who you are and how you can help.

steps.subtitle: Empathize and Anticipate
steps.bodytext: Now we have to put ourselves in the shoes of the person we are talking with. Think about all the questions or statments that they might ask or say and write each down. We are trying to anticipate as best as we can the specific conversation we will have. With as many of the different people as possible.

steps.subtitle: Identify Keywords
steps.bodytext: In order to maintain a conversation we need to be able to tell what questions we have been asked or statements have been made. Review all the sentences we just wrote and identify and document the important keywords of in those sentences. These will be used to identify the sentence.

steps.subtitle: Create Our Responses
steps.bodytext: Let's make the conversation flow. Having anticipated questions and statements and identified them with keywords we can now provide our response. For each question or statement we just wrote, write down an appropriate response that answers or continues the converstaion. Remember to write it in a way that conveys the personaility we defined.

steps.subtitle: Iterate
steps.bodytext: We are almost ready. Test the conversation on real people. Anytime you hear a keyword respond with your prepared answer. Does the conversation flow? Each time you encouter new questions or statements, add them to your list by identifying the keywords and writing a reponse. Continue iterating until it is meaningful for your customers.

subtitle: Let's Create.
bodytext: Now we are ready to get technology talking. We will use a specific platform, ____, to create our conversation experience.

subtitle: Let's Create.
bodytext: Now we are ready to get technology talking. We will use a specific platform, ____, to create our conversation experience.
